alert.note: Alert for Imperial; Riverside (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued June 26 at 5:40PM PDT until June 26 at 6:45PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Southwestern La Paz County in west central Arizona... Northeastern Imperial County in southeastern California... Riverside County in southern California... * Until 645 PM MST/645 PM PDT/. * At 540 PM MST/540 PM PDT/, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near Yuma Proving Ground to Cibola to 8 miles northwest of Palo Verde to 9 miles north of Midland, moving west at 15 mph. Traffic cameras in Blythe showed low visibility due to dense blowing dust. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 1 and 8. CA Interstate 10 between mile markers 119 and 156. AZ Route 95 between mile markers 69 and 70. Locations impacted include... Blythe, Nicholls Warm Springs, Cibola, Palo Verde, Midland, Blythe Airport, Ripley, East Blythe and Ehrenberg. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
